definition:
The [*autoregressive model*]{} of order $p$, denoted [*AR*]{}($p$), is a
random process model described by
$$y_{t} = \sum_{i=1}^{p} a_{i} y_{t-i} + c + e_{t}, \qquad t = 1, 2,\ldots$$
where $a_i$ are model parameters, $y_{t}$ is the model output in
discrete time instant $t$. Term $c$ is an absolute term (constant) and
$e_{t}$ denotes discrete white noise.

A first-order autoregression model [*AR*]{}(1) in the form
$y_{t} = a y_{t-1} + c +e _{t}$ is one major example.
